definition: to take as a guiding principle (idiom)
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do

guidepost/rule/standard/limit/target (old)

sentences.english: Over the last two centuries, his vision of the nation-state has become the norm.
sentences.chinese: 两个多世纪后，他关于民族国家的观点被奉为圭臬。

sentences.english: The British model, presented to us all as exemplary, simply could not last.
sentences.chinese: 被我们奉为圭臬的英国模式，是纯粹不能持久奉行的。
